newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel - cracked sector balanced, SR available.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel - cracked sector balanced, SR available.

text.p: Fuel oil was unchanged on Tuesday with high sulphur seen balanced to tight and low sulphur balanced and quiet.
High sulphur barges were very slow with prices about $2 a tonne lower at $125-127 fob ARA. Traders said slow bunker enquiries was weighing on the market as was Russian straight run material.

Two, possibly three Russian cargoes were sold on Monday with a trader, a major and a utility the suggested buyers. No prices were given, but dealers said good quality straight run with low water content offerred around $125 a tonne cif ARA, broadly on parity with high sulphur cracked fuel levels. Cargoes with higher water content were still talked in the low $120s, traders said.

Low sulphur cracked cargoes were quiet and balanced. "I see a couple of cargoes and a couple of buyers for second half November material," said one trader. Prices for November cargoes were offered at November swaps +$10-11, which at today's paper levels was $137-140 cif Italy. News that Turkey's Mersin refinery was halting production from Wednesday in a pricing dispute is expected to stop fuel oil output which should help the Med straight run market.
